benchmark_details.name: GVGAI-LLM
benchmark_details.overview: GVGAI-LLM is a video game benchmark for evaluating the reasoning and problem-solving capabilities of large language models (LLMs). It features a diverse collection of arcade-style games designed to test a modelâ€™s ability to handle tasks that differ from most existing LLM benchmarks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the decision-making competence of large language models in structured symbolic games and highlight their limitations in areas like spatial reasoning and planning.

data.source: General Video Game AI framework with over one hundred 2D video games defined using VGDL.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on agent performance measures including actions taken, successful game completions, and average steps.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better agent behavior and effectiveness in completing games.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across multiple agent types under the same experimental conditions.
